required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postmenopausal Evaluation and Risk-reduction With Lasofoxifene (PEARL)
clinical_study.official_title: PEARL: Postmenopausal Evaluation And Risk-Reduction With Lasofoxifene

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine the safety and effectiveness of 2 doses of the investigational drug, lasofoxifene, compared to placebo (an inactive substance) in reducing new spinal fractures in women with osteoporosis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

secondary_outcome.measure: All clinical fractures, non-vertebral fractures, BMD, breast cancer, cardiovascular events, and gynecological safety events
All clinical fractures, new morphometric vertebral fractures, BMD, cardiovascular events, and gynecological safety events

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Postmenopausal at least 5 years; Screening bone mineral density more than or equal to 2.5 S.D.s below the mean for young adults at the lumbar spine or femoral neck.
Exclusion Criteria:
Metabolic bone disease other than osteoporosis; Taking approved medications for osteoporosis; Have had a recent osteoporotic fracture (within 1 year) and/or have a bone mineral density more than 4.5 S.D.s below the mean for young adults at the lumbar spine or femoral neck.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.
